column4: does anyone know how to start gnome from vnc. gnome-session & doesn't work
you gotta stick /usr/bin/gnome-session in the vnc config file
i forget what its called...some . file in your home dir
already done
/home/username/.vnc/xstartup you mean
is gnome workin w/o vnc?
and i can start kde with startkde &
so startkde works under vnc?
i can use vino - but i want to have a virtual session
yes
try using tightvnc or one of the other ones
might be a realvnc specific issue
or visa-versa
ok
both realvnc & tightvnc work with kde but neither will start gnome with gnome-session &
are you just putting in gnome-session, or the absolute path?
yeah, but relying on $PATH isnt recomended
how are you starting vnc?
with vncserver as a user
it really sounds like a gnome specific issue, irc.gimp.org has most of the gnome devs in there, they might know something
